definitions: To scatter or disperse in various directions.
To cause to disappear or to be dispelled.
To spend or use wastefully or extravagantly.
To indulge in pleasure to an excessive degree.
examples: The fog began to dissipate as the sun rose.
He tends to dissipate his energy on trivial matters.
The storm clouds will dissipate by morning.
She watched her savings dissipate over the years.
